qas.question: What region was the center of the Odrysian Kingdom?
Who used Thracians and Agrianes as light cavalry?
What fraction of Alexander's army was made up of Thracians and Agrianes?
What language was spoken by the Odrysians?
Which kings wre among the first to be Hellenized?

context: The Odrysian Kingdom was a union of Thracian tribes under the kings of the powerful Odrysian tribe centered around the region of <a0_0>Thrace<a0_0/>. Various parts of Thrace were under Macedonian rule under Philip II of Macedon, Alexander the Great, Lysimachus, Ptolemy II, and Philip V but were also often ruled by their own kings. The Thracians and Agrianes were widely used by <a1_0>Alexander<a1_0/> as peltasts and light cavalry, forming about <a2_0>one fifth<a2_0/> of his army. The Diadochi also used Thracian mercenaries in their armies and they were also used as colonists. The Odrysians used <a3_0>Greek<a3_0/> as the language of administration and of the nobility. The nobility also adopted Greek fashions in dress, ornament and military equipment, spreading it to the other tribes. <a4_0>Thracian<a4_0/> kings were among the first to be Hellenized.
